    • Method Detail

      • trapezoidal

        public static MotionProfile trapezoidal(double dx,
                                        double Vo,
                                        double maxAccel,
                                        double maxDecel,
                                        double maxSpeed)
        Creates a MotionProfile that is the fastest way to travel a certain distance. It is "trapezoidal" in nature because the speed graph, in the simplest case, looks like a trapezoid: a positive slope (acceleration), a horizontal line at top (max speed), and a negative slope (deceleration).
        Some important edge cases:
        If the max speed cannot be reached the speed graph will be a triangle, not a trapezoid.
        If the robot cannot stop in time it will decelerate as fast as possible, accelerate backwards, and decelerate again.
        If the initial velocity is in the opposite direction of the distance then the robot will decelerate as fast as possible and then accelerate and decelerate towards the direction of the distance.
        Parameters:
        dx - The distance to be traveled (area under the trapezoid), may be positive or negative
        Vo - The initial velocity, may be positive or negative
        maxAccel - The maximum acceleration of the robot, by convention positive
        maxDecel - The maximum deceleration of the robot, by convention positive
        maxSpeed - The maximum speed of the robot, by convention positive
        Returns:
        The MotionProfile representing the path of the robot

      • calculateTopSpeed

        private static double calculateTopSpeed(double dx,
                                        double Vo,
                                        double a,
                                        double d)
        Returns the height of the triangular speed profile. In other words, how fast you can possibly go with constant acceleration and constant deceleration in the given x. It is interpreted as a speed, not a velocity, so it could be negative. However, just assume everything is positive and convert later.
        Parameters:
        dx - The magnitude of the distance to travel
        Vo - The magnitude of the initial velocity
        a - The acceleration, the right side of the triangle
        d - The deceleration, the left side of the triangle
        Returns:
        The magnitude of the max velocity of the triangle

      • combine

        public static MotionProfile combine(MotionProfile... motionProfiles)
        Makes use of the CombinedProfile class
        Parameters:
        motionProfiles - The MotionProfiles to combine
        Returns:
        The single, combined MotionProfile
